Posts.Content:
Hi Tammid. Did you see your surgeon today? If so were some of your questions answered? I had a second mammogram today and a sonogram is supposed to be scheduled within a week. I am freaking out with worry and I know you must be feeling the same way. 
For me, it helps to share the worry with someone who knows exactly what it's like. Thanks for sharing and being on the forum.
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content: Tammid I am so happy to hear your news!!!! We both have LOTS to be thankful for.
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content: Talia my heart goes out to you. I do hope your mouth is feeling somewhat better today. Your inner strength is there, you may just have to dig a little deeper to find it on days like today.
Posts.Title: Update

Posts.Content:
Lisa, I am so sorry that you have to make this choice. I wanted to reply to your post even though I have no experience with your kind of situation. I am still awaiting results from tests after masses were found in both my breasts. 
If you have a good support system within your family, listen to their suggestions about
 if and why they might support one of your options over another. That may give you peace in making the final decision.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Talia and Tammid I seem to be one step behind you ladies. I got the call that my mammogram showed a 1cm spot on EACH breast. I am scheduled for another, more in-depth mammogram (although I don't know what that means) tomorrow. 
It is scary and I will add both of you to my fervent prayers.
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content: Tammid, I go for my sonogram today. Will keep you posted.
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content: Alexikins, I am almost old enough to be your grandmother, but any suspicious mass is a very scary thing. My breast issues are not the same as yours but our fears are similar and justified. I pray you find peace in your heart as you await further news.
Posts.Title: 23, Breast Masses and Scared

Posts.Content: After a week of fretting over no news, I got GOOD NEWS today. The sonogram showed nothing at all, and the 2nd mammogram, the close-up of the "trouble spots" in each breast, were diagnosed as benign macro calcifications. I was told not to worry, and just be sure to get an annual mammogram to make sure there are no changes. It had been 5 years since my previous mammo and you can be sure I won't let that happen again. Thank you to everyone who listened to my concerns and responded to my worries. You are all strong women who I admire very much.
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content: Back and forth to the "city" (no matter what city) can be a tiring experience even when we're feeling good. How far must you travel?
Posts.Title: Update

Posts.Content:
Talia I love your attitude! Sounds like you found a good match with your oncologist/ chemo doc. I pray all goes smoothly for you from here on out.
BTW, I am going for my sonogram today.
